item.title: Patricia add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Patricia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Patricia add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Patricia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I was with book, as a woman is with child." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "My grandma always said that God made libraries so that people didn't have any excuse to be stupid." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Patricia add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "There's a humorous side to every situation. The challenge is to find it." -- George Carlin

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Don't look at me in that tone of voice." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I like to have a martini, Two at the very most. After three I'm under the table, after four I'm under my host." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "By the time you swear you're his, Shivering and sighing. And he vows his passion is, Infinite, undying. Lady make note of this -- One of you is lying." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "They sicken of the calm who know the storm." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "You can lead a horticulture, but you can't make her think." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The first thing I do in the morning is brush my teeth and sharpen my tongue." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Heterosexuality is not normal, it's just common." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "<b>Résumé</b> Razors pain you, Rivers are damp, Acids stain you, And drugs cause cramp. Guns aren't lawful, Nooses give, Gas smells awful. You might as well live." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If I didn't care for fun and such, I'd probably amount to much. But I shall stay the way I am, Because I do not give a damn." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "What fresh hell is this?" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I hate writing, I love having written." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Patricia add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Take me or leave me; or, as is the usual order of things, both." -- Dorothy Parker
